questions.question: What is the amplitude of the wave shown in the figure?
questions.explanation: The amplitude is the maximum displacement from the equilibrium position. From the graph, the wave oscillates between +4 m and -4 m, so the amplitude is 4 m.

questions.question: What is the wavelength of the wave shown in the figure?
questions.explanation: The wavelength is the distance for one complete cycle. From the graph, the distance from point B to point F is one complete cycle, which measures 5 m.

questions.question: How many complete wavelengths are shown in the figure?
questions.explanation: Counting the complete cycles from the starting point to the end of the graph shows 3 full wavelengths are displayed.

questions.question: What is the wave's displacement ($y$) at the position $x = 3 \text{ m}$?
questions.explanation: At $x = 3 \text{ m}$, the graph shows the wave's displacement is approximately $-2.2 \text{ m}$ below the equilibrium line.

questions.question: What is the wave's displacement ($y$) at the position $x = 2.5 \text{ m}$?
questions.explanation: At $x = 2.5 \text{ m}$, the wave crosses the equilibrium position, so the displacement is $0 \text{ m}$.

questions.question: Which of the following pairs of points represents one complete wavelength?
questions.explanation: Points B to F show one complete cycle of the wave, from one point on the wave to the next corresponding point, covering exactly one wavelength of 5 m.

questions.question: How many nodes (points of zero displacement) are visible in this wave pattern?
questions.explanation: Nodes are points where the wave crosses the equilibrium position ($y=0$). Counting all crossing points in the graph gives 7 nodes.

questions.question: Which of the following positions is a node?
questions.explanation: At $x = 7.5 \text{ m}$, the wave crosses the equilibrium line ($y=0$), making it a node.

questions.question: How many antinodes (points of maximum displacement) are visible in this wave pattern?
questions.explanation: Antinodes are points of maximum positive or negative displacement. Counting all peaks and troughs in the graph gives 6 antinodes.

questions.question: Which of the following positions is an antinode?
questions.explanation: At $x = 3.75 \text{ m}$, the wave reaches its maximum positive displacement (+4 m), making it an antinode.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent wave analysis! You can extract detailed properties from graphical representations.
scoreMessages.70: Strong work! You understand most wave concepts from graphs. Review node/antinode identification and wave calculations.
scoreMessages.50: Good foundation. Focus on distinguishing between wavelength, amplitude, and identifying wave features on graphs.
